original_title: Hackaday Podcast 222: VCF East Special Edition
original_content:
Editor in Chief Elliot Williams is spending the week communing with nature, which under normal circumstances would mean no podcast  after all, hes the one who puts each episode together. But since your weekend would obviously be ruined without a dose of lo-fi Hackaday beats to kick things off, Managing Editor Tom Nardi made a valiant attempt to go it alone and producesomething.
This shortened episode will briefly go over the news, including updates about Hackadays various ongoing contests and the recent unearthly conditions in the US Northeast due to the Canadian wildfires, before diving into the results of last weeks Whats that Sound challenge. Listeners will then be treated to a special Quick Hacks segment from Jenny List, before settling in for the main event: a pair of fascinating interviews recorded during the 2023 Vintage Computer Festival East in Wall, NJ.
Check out the links below if you want to follow along, and as always, tell us what you think about this episode in the comments!

Feel free to download the MP3 directly for safe keeping.
